meanings.definition: The action of causing suffering or harm.
meanings.sent1: The infliction of pain on others is never acceptable.
meanings.sent2: The infliction of punishment should be fair and just.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly infliction of tickles made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her words were an infliction on his wounded heart.
meanings.sent5: The infliction of a broken promise can hurt deeply.

meanings.definition: Something that causes suffering or harm.
meanings.sent1: Bullying is an infliction that should never be ignored.
meanings.sent2: The infliction of a lie can damage trust.
meanings.sent3: The constant rain was an infliction on our outdoor plans.
meanings.sent4: The loss of a loved one is an infliction that leaves a lasting mark.
meanings.sent5: The infliction of loneliness can be overwhelming.
